column2: LOUISIANA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column8: at most intersections.

column2: 2. What does this road sign indicate?
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities
column8: Hospital service

column2: 3. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 4. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: you may stop to let out passengers.
column8: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column10: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.

column2: 5. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 6. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column8: no sharp turn

column2: 7. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column6: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column8: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column10: reduce speed and increase following distance.

column2: 8. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Leave the road immediately.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 9. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column10: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.

column2: 10. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 11. This sign warns that:
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: traffic must merge left.

column2: 12. This road sign:
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column10: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 13. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column8: are changing lanes.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column10: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.

column2: 15. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column8: lane ends, merge left.

column2: 17. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column8: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column10: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 18. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column8: there is a right turn ahead.
column10: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 19. A flashing red light means:
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 20. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column8: at a stop sign.

column2: 21. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 22. When drivers see this road sign:
column6: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column10: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.

column2: 23. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: reduce the reaction distance.

column2: 24. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column10: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 25. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 26. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 27. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column8: Get enough sleep.

column2: 28. This road sign warns drivers that:
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 29. A red traffic sign means?
column8: Do not enter.

column2: 30. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column8: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 31. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column8: stay in the center of your lane
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 32. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.

column2: 33. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column8: School zone

column2: 34. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column8: parallel to the curb.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 36. Alcohol causes:
column8: loss of concentration.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Cars in right lane must slow down
column8: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 38. This sign indicates:
column4: Do not use your phone while driving
column8: Phone service ahead

column2: 39. This warning sign means:
column6: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 40. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column8: the time of day.
column10: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
